_header: Saint Mildred the holy maid to tell by right doom
Subjects: saints’ lives; Mildred, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Mildred in the South English Legendary — couplets

Bod779.First Lines:
seint myldre þe holy mayd to telle be ryȝt dombore was in
                    ingelond in þe ferste cristindom…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& went to þe ioy of heuin þer as ȝhe ȝit
                    isnow god vs wisse þilke wey þat we ne go amys

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Mildride þe holi Mayde of kynges kunne comI bore heo was
                    in Engelonde in þe furste cristendom…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And wende to þe Ioye of heuene þer as heo ȝit
                    isNou God vs sende þulke wey þat we blenche not amis.
                    A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seinte Mildride þe holi maide of kinges kunne comIbore heo was in engelonde in þe vurste cristendom…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …& wende to þe ioie of heuene þer as heo ȝut isNow god vs sende þulke wey þat we ne blenche not amis
